data.title: Where can I get the cheapest bi-focals?
data.meta_description: After 5 years, I really need to get this prescription strengthened.  But last time I went to Wal-mart and ended up paying over $400.  I want to get a pair of regular glasses and a pair of either veralux or transitions lenses that get darker, or prescription sunglasses.  Anyone with experie...
data.text:
Nanwa

Power Poster

Joined:

Posts: 5,564

Clintonville, WI, USA

After 5 years, I really need to get this prescription strengthened. But last time I went to Wal-mart and ended up paying over $400. I want to get a pair of regular glasses and a pair of either veralux or transitions lenses that get darker, or prescription sunglasses.

Anyone with experience with transitions or veralux lenses that darken outside? Are they really dark, or should I get the separate pair of sunglasses? I try to read outside in Florida, and need something dark.

_________________________

Member of the National Sarcasm Society - like we need your support!

Dlynn58

Platinum Poster

Joined:

Posts: 789

Texas

I have a pair of transitions and I love them. They don't get quite as dark as a pair of sunglasses, but I still like them. I'm in Texas and even reading outside does not bother me with them on. I think they get dark enough.

Truffle Royale

10K Club

Joined:

Posts: 17,408

I was advised against transitions because they don't get dark enough. Our older eyes are more sensitive to light, especially if your eyes are blue/green rather than brown.

Seeing as how we're in the same state, I went to Dr. Barne's Eyemart Express with my prescription. I got prescription bi-focal sunglasses for about $150, if I remember correctly. I got a cute, lightweight plastic frame for $49 plus the lens cost. It might be higher if you go with scratch coating, etc. They've got a good guarantee too that replaced the frame when it broke, no questions asked.

Retread

Power Poster

Joined:

Posts: 2,548

Southeast

I have had progressive lenses for at least 20 years and love them. I have had both Varilux and Transitions. I prefer the Varilux, but the cost can be outrageous. I currently have Transitions and like them okay. I was asked if it bothered me that they do not darken in the car, but I told them I hadn't noticed, so I guess it doesn't. If you think it would bother you, you might want to go with the prescription sunglasses.

_________________________

Politicians are like diapers. They need to be changed often and for the same reason.

tahdah

Platinum Poster

Joined:

Posts: 932

I had the same experience as Retread, my doctor said that the Transitions would not work well driving in the car on a sunny day. Since I'm in Mi,( or maybe it would be on a sunny snowy day) not a real big deal but in Fl I would think it would be.

Nanwa

Power Poster

Joined:

Posts: 5,564

Clintonville, WI, USA

Since I had the shingles in my eye, I am extremely sensitive to light, so I think I might get prescription sunglasses AND regular glasses with veralux.

Truffle, my eyes are hazel, which means when I wear green they look green, when I wear brown, they look brown. Better than colored contacts! I think I may try that Eyemart Express. They are the only ones around here that offer two for one, so I make get some kind of break on the price.

Member of the National Sarcasm Society - like we need your support!

Fraudman CFCI

Power Poster

Joined:

Posts: 3,189

Land of Steady Habits

I (eye) wear progressive bi-focal lens glasses. I was told transition lenses do not work while you are in an auto...they are UV sensitive.

I have a pair of dark polarized glasses I wear while driving in sunlight and my regular glasses. Obviously, I wear them at other times, too. I purchased these from Lenscrafters.

I find this works best for me and do not consider this an inconvenience.

thomasj

Power Poster

Joined:

Posts: 5,063

Pennsylvania

Polarized prescription sunglasses ROCK! I had a pair made a few years ago, and though my prescription has changed slightly, I still think I see more clearly with those polarized glasses than my regular lenses. There is something about the polarized lenses that makes them much superior to regular tinted lenses. I go to the eye doc next week and will likely get the sunglasses updated.
